Sentencas: The effects of through-thickness pinholes in an electrolyte on re-oxidation and mechanical damage of anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells are discussed in this paper.
Titulo: Effect of pinholes in electrolyte on re-oxidation tolerance of anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Pinholes with a dimension greater than approximately 10 mu m were detected by dye penetrant inspection using half-cells fabricated through a co-sintering method.
Titulo: Effect of pinholes in electrolyte on re-oxidation tolerance of anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In single cells with such pinholes, the leakage of oxygen occurred through the through-thickness pinholes under open-circuit voltage (OCV) conditions when the fuel supply was discontinued.
Titulo: Effect of pinholes in electrolyte on re-oxidation tolerance of anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The oxygen leakage caused the oxidation of Ni in the anode, forming semicircular re-oxidized regions on the electrolyte side of the anode substrate.
Titulo: Effect of pinholes in electrolyte on re-oxidation tolerance of anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The oxygen permeation fluxes in the electrolyte, which were deduced from the measured reduction in OCV during the operation of fuel shut-off, are shown to correlate well with the time elapsed from the shut-off of the fuel gas supply to the onset of mechanical damage monitored by acoustic emissions.
Titulo: Effect of pinholes in electrolyte on re-oxidation tolerance of anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The correlation indicates that the oxidation rate of the anode substrate is accelerated due to the presence of pinholes in the electrolyte, which can result in mechanical damages.
Titulo: Effect of pinholes in electrolyte on re-oxidation tolerance of anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells
